intro: Reseda neglecta, commonly known as common reseda, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom from June to August, and its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate in shape. Reseda neglecta is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in waste areas. It is characterized by its fibrous root system and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
